dcterms:creator: S. Koelstra
C. Muhl
M. Soleymani
A. Yazdani
J.-S. Lee
T. Ebrahimi
T. Pun
A. Nijholt
I. Patras
dcterms:description: The DEAP dataset was recorded from 32 subjects while they watched 40 one-minute music videos. EEG recordings were taken via 32 channels at a sampling rate of 512 Hz, later downsampled to 128 Hz. Participants rated the videos based on Arousal, Valence, Dominance, Liking, and Familiarity.
dcterms:title: DEAP Dataset

dcterms:creator: W.-L. Zheng
B.-L. Lu
dcterms:description: The SEED dataset consists of EEG signals recorded from 15 participants while they watched 15 handpicked movie clips. The EEG data was recorded via 62 channels at a sampling rate of 1000 Hz, later downsampled to 200 Hz. The dataset includes predefined labels for positive and negative emotions.
dcterms:title: SEED Dataset

dcterms:creator: A. Shoeb
dcterms:description: The CHB-MIT dataset consists of EEG signals recorded from 23 children with epilepsy. The recordings were taken over several days following the withdrawal of anti-seizure treatment, using 22 channels at a sampling rate of 256 Hz. The dataset includes annotations for seizure onset and offset.
dcterms:title: CHB-MIT Dataset
